meanings.definition: A principle of order and knowledge in Greek philosophy.
meanings.sent1: In Greek philosophy, the logoi help us understand the world around us.
meanings.sent2: She presented a compelling logoi to support her theory.
meanings.sent3: The logoi decided to have a party to bring order to their chaotic week.
meanings.sent4: The logoi of nature whispered secrets of the universe to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The logoi of wisdom guided the ancient scholars in their quest for knowledge.

meanings.sent1: His logoi in the debate were well thought out and persuasive.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't understand the logoi he was trying to make.
meanings.sent3: The logoi about who ate the last cookie sparked a hilarious argument.
meanings.sent4: Her logoi cut through the confusion like a sharp sword.
meanings.sent5: The logoi he presented left no room for doubt or confusion.

meanings.definition: The divine reason implicit in the cosmos, ordering it and giving it form and meaning.
meanings.sent1: The logoi of the universe bring harmony to all things.
meanings.sent2: Ancient philosophers pondered the logoi behind the creation of the world.
meanings.sent3: The logoi of the stars danced across the night sky in a cosmic ballet.
meanings.sent4: The logoi of existence whispered secrets of eternity to those who sought them.
meanings.sent5: The logoi of creation wove a tapestry of beauty and purpose in the cosmos.
